website_summaries.verdict: As ugly and cumbersome as it makes the 3DS, the Circle Pad Pro is actually a great-performing accessory that improves the control range of games that it's compatible with.
pros: The Nintendo 3DS Circle Pad Pro adds a right circle pad and two extra trigger buttons to the 3DS
It's easy to use and simple to set up, and improves control options for compatible games, not to mention improving the 3DS' overall ergonomics
Priced at $20, it's an accessory that won't break the bank
cons: The Circle Pad Pro feels so good that it makes us wonder why Nintendo didn't include one in the first place
It's bulky and makes the 3DS cumbersome to carry around, limiting its overall mobility
The attachment blocks a lot of connectivity ports and also requires a AAA battery to work

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Not much else to say about it, it works as said and it adds some great functions to the 3ds. I hated waiting for it but I also couldn't play luigi's mansion without it, I just don't like motion controls. I haven't tested it out with other games but I could see myself going back and playing the old supersmash with it. Overall it has a great battery life and I'm very happy with the product. It holds up well after use.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, prevents hands from cramping during long gaming sessions
customer_reviews.text: NO LONGER MUST MY LARGE HANDS CRAMP WHILE PLAYING MONSTER HUNTER The extra circle pad makes camera movement in some games very convenient, IF you choose to use it. The main nice benefit is the large grip, however. Works on NA 3DS's with no issue. I don't see why these aren't sold domestically in stores, they're great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mondragon

customer_reviews.title: A Useful Accessory For the Original 3DS
customer_reviews.text: It makes your 3DS bulky and ugly, but it's a great extension. The second slider feels the same as the one on the console and the additional buttons are great. If you put your 3DS to sleep, the accessory occasionally disconnects when you wake the console up. It works just fine after reconnecting. The quality is great coming straight from Nintendo. I would definitely recommend it for anyone not looking to upgrade to the New 3DS.
customer_reviews.author: MartyMcFly

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is, but needs more games.
customer_reviews.text: If only there were more games that support this gadget. This device provides a much-needed second analog and extended shoulder button. Installation is a snap (literally...) and the device picks it up instantly when you boot up a compatible game. I use it for the Sega 3-D Classics arcade games (After Burner II with this is a revelation). Recommended if you have the games that match. I'd love to see Nintendo offer Circle Pad Pro support for Super Smash Bros., however.
customer_reviews.author: @twoheadedjohn

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit beaten up when I opened the package, I don't know why that is but I wont complain if it still works. It had marks all over it, still it came on time so I guess it's alright. 5 stars ( try not to damage the items I purchase please ) the box itself was undamaged it was only the product itself... nothing else to note
customer_reviews.author: G V

customer_reviews.title: Works Beautifly! :3
customer_reviews.text: It came home safe and seems to work perfectly so far. The CPP helps out so much when playing the Monster Hunter games. I have both 4U and Generations so I'm quite happy. My only gripe is that I wish that Nintendo could have made different colors. The CPP looks pretty ugly against the the other 3DS colors. Again I definitely recommend this product! :3
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Hegan

customer_reviews.title: It does its job well.
customer_reviews.text: It's not the most comfortable attachment, but it works well enough for games that support it. I'd recommend it for anyone wanting to try out Monster Hunter. Though, for anyone just looking for a grip attachment, I'd recommend the Hori stand over this.
customer_reviews.author: TecXero

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great. A must have for a number of games, like Monster Hunter, or Resident Evil Revelaitons. :D
customer_reviews.author: Nick H.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but does feel cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and fits in your hands comfortably. The plastic feels really cheap and it could break easily. It works perfectly and fits the orginal Nintendo 3Ds albeit having scratches on the product when received.
customer_reviews.author: JAnderson11335

customer_reviews.title: It's very confortable on the hands with the strange ergonomic design and the circle pad feels just like left circle pad
customer_reviews.text: It's legit and it makes hunting on MH4U a bit easier. It's very confortable on the hands with the strange ergonomic design and the circle pad feels just like left circle pad. It only requires a quarter to screw open the battery compartment and it comes with a battery for you to insert it. The only drawback to the device it blocks the stylus and cartridge slots so you will have to remove the device in order to remove the stylus or remove/switch the cartridge, but it's not a big deal breaker. There is no reason to upgrade to the New 3DS.
customer_reviews.author: YungMono

customer_reviews.title: Its a good thing this item is comfortable to hold and play ...
customer_reviews.text: Its just what i needed to play my 3ds. I have big hands and it is a pain to play games without some kind of grip. I also wanted another analog stick for my games. Its a good thing this item is comfortable to hold and play with.
customer_reviews.author: Rick5

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for Monster Hunter.
customer_reviews.text: You play Monster Hunter? You don't -need- this but it makes life a ton easier.It does obscure the IR sensor on the back and it makes getting to the stylus a chore.

customer_reviews.title: Needed
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a friend's birthday and he wanted to play Monster Hunter 3 Ultimate. It's so much better than without it that it's pretty much the same experience on the Wii U, just on the go.
customer_reviews.author: jolly jared

customer_reviews.title: Takes a bit to get used to, but an overall good product.
customer_reviews.text: When I received the product, it was kind of dirty and clearly used more than what was advertised. It was nothing a few cleaning pads couldn't fix. The additional pad initially feels great since I have larger hands, but getting used to using the extra shoulder buttons took some time. I was playing Kid Icuras, so that probably wasn't the best game to start playing right off the bat, lol. Still, it does make games easier to play. The bulkier 3DS is a plus as well.
customer_reviews.author: Aramis Adams

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Just to clear this, the circle pad DOES help grip, you just have to get used to it, its like switching from a ps3 controller to xbox. It works wonders in MHX, I would definitely recommend this to anyone who plays. I don't use the analog stick much, but its there if I need to, the real thing that makes it worth it is the bumpers, instead if small bumpers you get ps3 style L and R buttons. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Emory

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I haven't taken this thing off of my 3ds since I bought it and I also purchased the 3ds XL version for my girlfriend. Some people have mentioned the size as being a bit "bulky" but, for my big hands, this thing's a godsend.

The stick support is exactly what I expected (it works great for Monster Hunter), but the overall grip isn't nearly as ergonomic as I would have liked. I'm happy I bought it, but was definitely expecting something better.

product_meta.title: Nintendo 3DS slide pad dedicated expansion
product_meta.description: Attach the Circle Pad Pro to the Nintendo 3DS system and play specially designed games with an additional circle pad and more shoulder control. Circle Pad Pro can only be used with the Nintendo 3DS system and only works with specially designed games displaying the Circle Pad Icon. Please refer to the back of your 3DS game case to see if the game uses the Circle Pad Pro.
feature_bullets: Attaches to your Nintendo 3DS for an enhanced gaming experience
Works only with specially designed games for the 3DS.
The Circle Pad Pro works only with the 3DS
Adds an extra circle pad stick and more shoulder buttons.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars280 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
